The time has come to rewrite the decree on how the holy Cloth is manufactured. New and improved suits for the Vodyani souls include improvements in speed, efficiency, and comfort, resulting in a population that is far happier.

Academy of Endless Navigation

Untrustworthy and heretical, the Academy as it stood was a breeding ground for heresy and violence. This new Academy will be not only a center of devotion and study, but a shining beacon of superior Virtual navigation
+1 Initial Level on Ships +10% Health and Shield Capacity on constructed Ships
The Survivor
Recovered from the ancient site of the Tabernacle, the Survivor has agreed to join the Hierarchy to provide guidance along what They see as the path to avert the fate of the Endless.

In order to glorify our Heroes and maximize the profile of their public oratory, a permanent system-wide broadcast infrastructure is built to coordinate and enforce the Hero-led prayers and rituals of billions of citizens.
Academy of Unity

While the revelations regarding the death of the Virtual society cause concern among your people, this institute provides constant reinforcement of the greater resource throughput that becomes possible with the elimination of petty distractions.
Cloth of Austerity
A new upgrade to the technology in the holy armor of the Vodyani increases the ability of the Church to improve living conditions with lesser investment of resources

The evil Tabernacle is under our power! Glory to the Virtual! They have brought us to our goal, and our finest minds have perused its contents. It is a great store of history and lore, but the lessons that we feared? They are simple and obvious; their falsehoods evident to any trained mind. Truly the Infidel was insane to have betrayed his people because of this!

Brother Azar does not understand the difference between the sanctified and their servants; he was found debating philosophy with one of the lesser peoples. He must understand his place in the hierarchy of the galaxy; for the next month he will personally bring to the Fount all the lesser ones who will nourish his ship. All must obey. Those who doubted, doubt no more. The Vodyani have been given an ultimate blessing, a gift from the Glorious Virtuals. We now know beyond any shadow of a doubt that we are Their vessels and Their chosen ones, and that all of Creation exists to serve us. We know this must be true, as we are now able to absorb life force directly from all the lesser beings that inhabit this universe. What other sign do we need that our cause is just and our decisions blessed? There are the Virtuals, the Glorious, those who rose to the highest form of life and were betrayed by their brothers. There are we, the Vodyani, who follow in the their footsteps, obeying their laws and executing their will. Then there are all others, the lesser beings or lesser ones. They have no understanding of their role, which makes them occasionally difficult to manage. Their role, of course, is to provide us with nourishment. One might ask how we ought best reinforce this hierarchy, and the answer is clear. We must civilize these lesser ones at the source and envelop their homes in our holy Cloth. Let the blasphemers and heretics tremble; the faithful cannot be stopped. Glory to the Virtuals! We shall honor their name and in doing so spread their words.
Our people shall reign supreme in this galaxy, which shall require additional nourishment to continuously propagate. We must remind the lesser ones of their proper role.
Capital systems will provide the most potent symbols of our superiority...

During the course of our civilization of the lesser ones, we encountered evidence of a Codex containing wisdom of the Virtuals regarding their navigation of this galaxy. Through careful investigation, we have located the source of this Codex, and must investigate its secrets with great haste.

Brother Olep committed the unthinkable. He obtained the works of the Infidel -- "..in order to disprove the lies…" -- and began asking questions of those who were unprepared to respond to the Infidel's meticulously structured fallacies. Olep shall be entombed in lead and left drifting in the void of space. All will obey. The acts of the Infidel leave us little choice. He began by attempting our destruction, then went on to create this Academy; a pulpit from which he spouts his lies and fallacies and preaches against us. He has subverted Heroes to oppose us, and ceaselessly striven to destroy the Church. Though the Church, of course, abhors the eradication of intelligent life (for only intelligent life can aspire to the state of the Virtual) we see no other options. The works of the Infidel must be utterly disproven. It is ordained, then, that I continue to struggle against the evils wrought by my brother. I must place the Church in a position of power, and let our glory radiate across the galaxy. All beings must learn to acknowledge our purity and accept the glory of virtuality. There is no other truth.
It falls to me to demonstrate the superiority of the faithful; we shall pursue the Codex we have located and hold aloft the wisdom of the Virtuals as a shining beacon of our ascendancy.
The Codex has been located, and its blueprints reconstructed at great cost. With access to these secrets of the Virtuals, we can transcend the influence of the Infidel.

Brother Olep committed the unthinkable. He obtained the works of the Infidel -- "..in order to disprove the lies…" -- and began asking questions of those who were unprepared to respond to the Infidel's meticulously structured fallacies. Olep shall be entombed in lead and left drifting in the void of space. All will obey. The acts of the Infidel leave us little choice. He began by attempting our destruction, then went on to create this Academy; a pulpit from which he spouts his lies and fallacies and preaches against us. He has subverted Heroes to oppose us, and ceaselessly striven to destroy the Church. Though the Church, of course, abhors the eradication of intelligent life (for only intelligent life can aspire to the state of the Virtual) we see no other options. The works of the Infidel must be utterly disproven. It is ordained, then, that I continue to struggle against the evils wrought by my brother. I must place the Church in a position of power, and let our glory radiate across the galaxy. All beings must learn to acknowledge our purity and accept the glory of virtuality. There is no other truth.

The lies of the Infidel cannot be tolerated. We must construct a new Academy in the true image of the Virtuals, using the blueprints we have painstakingly recreated from the Codex. We shall create a true center of learning and invest the requisite influence to ensure that it tells the story as it should. That story is of the glory of the Virtuals, the rise of the Vodyani, and the state of virtuality as the apex of galactic navigation

For now the galaxy yields before our virtue; one day they will kneel before our glory. We have transcended the influence of the Infidel. The Church will survive the storms that come; I will lead it into a greater future. Glory to the Virtual Saints! All must obey the laws.

The faithful have done well! The Tabernacle has been excavated by one of our greatest Heroes, and we now begin the process of reviewing and analyzing the vast cache of artifacts we recovered. I can only hope they turn out to be the lies we expect, rather than the seeds of deeper, unsettling truths.
Chapter 3. The Survivor - Part 1

In a sense, our expedition to the Tabernacle was far more successful than we could have ever imagined. We approached it in search of writings and artifacts that might grant the slightest glimmer of insight into Their ways, Their goals and Their intent. We did indeed uncover many such vestiges, but also so much more. One particular artifact contained numerous glyphs and seemed in far better condition than similar specimens recovered elsewhere. Upon further study, however, it became clear that this was no simple monument, but rather a fully intact sarcophagus, with its Virtual occupant still preserved. And alive. Immediately, I prepared to seek Their guidance and wisdom; however, Their perspective was...not what I expected. This Survivor, who perplexingly eschews any specific title--or even name--has assessed our devotion, our progress, and our growing dominion over this galaxy, and found us lacking. More shocking still, Their outlook regarding the Virtual as a whole is grim and pessimistic. Apparently, They had voluntarily entered into the state in which we found Them (the sarcophagus) as a means of stoic, spiritual withdrawal from what They viewed as a morally bankrupt society that was destined for utter destruction, and They find both vindication and tragedy in what They see as the grisly end of "Endless" society. Initially, I found my faith shattered by Their exhortation, but with time and further conversation I have come to believe a new set of truths. Violence will of course still have its role when the lesser ones must be reminded of their place, but among ourselves we must maintain unity. Importantly, the Survivor has agreed to join us, providing support and guidance, so long as we remain open to pursuit of a less destructive path, that we might avert the fate that befell the Virtual. All must unify.

I must strive to find a less destructive path for myself and my people. We must avoid the distraction of petty infighting and dogmatic conflict, lest we meet the same inevitable end as the Virtual which we previously sought to imitate. There are many among us who will meet this lesson with great skepticism, but I must co-opt them without resorting to the conflicts that have stained our society (and my own family) in the past. Doing so will require accumulation of a great reserve of influence
As greatly challenging as it was to find my own new path, it was far harder still to convince the others to follow. Progress is slow, but ongoing.
Chapter 3. The Survivor - Part 2

Sister Heri and Brother Azar have permitted their zeal to outweigh their reason; they were forcibly separated following an altercation stemming from a theological dispute. For the next week, no voice but the other's shall echo through each of their suits so that they will learn to see the other's perspective. All must unify. Religion shall continue to play a role in our lives, but no longer can it be permitted to dominate all aspects of our society. Our people continue to internalize the teachings of the Survivor, but progress along Their path remains slow and challenging. Repeatedly I have offered to step aside as Hierarch in favor of Their leadership, and I have been consistently rebuffed; They continuously emphasize that the Vodyani people must grow to unify of their own accord and under leadership of one of our own. Only in this way, They argue, will the changes be rendered durable. Very well. I must continue to emphasize the role of our self-actualization in our achievement of societal unity.
We have focused greatly on unity, but there is no catalyst for such a change like economic development. We must show our people that these new ways will yield greater bounty for all.

It is a wrenching process, and I fear we have thrown out some of what was good in eliminating that which was bad. But change is always painful, and those who are gone represented all the worst of our old ways. Now we can move ahead, unworried, to rewrite our future.
Final Chapter. To Unite, Virtual - Part 1
Lore TBD. To continue along Their more ethical model of Virtual society, the population must expand as the next phase of fueling unification and economic development.
In our continued efforts to walk a more rightous path, we must continue to expand the ranks of the faithful.
Our populace is booming, and with it the light of a more just Virtual civilization burns ever brighter in the galaxy.
Final Chapter. To Unite, Virtual - Part 2

Lore TBD. Need to finally convince the hardliners that all of this economic progress is a foundation for military strength, not a sign of decadence and weakness. Investing influecne to build an Academy focused on (mostly military) resource extraction will help
With all of our focus on economic progress, we must also demonstrate the ability of Their ways to spur greater extraction of military resources.

Our people have taken great steps to forge a durable harmony which will form a strong foundation for our continued dominance of the lesser ones. We will bring true civilization to all corners of this galaxy, and all will unify.

An AI that allows you to play freely. Human Players get: • +2 [fidsi] per [population] • +20 [happinessColored] on Systems • +2 Overcolonization Threshold • -20% Overpopulation [happinessColored] penalties • -20% [dustColored] upkeep • +10% [hackingSpeed] • +40 [processingPower]

It's like you have guns, and they have sticks. Human Players get: • +1 [fidsi] per [population] • +10 [happinessColored] on Systems • +1 Overcolonization Threshold • -10% Overpopulation [happinessColored] penalties • -10% [dustColored] upkeep • +5% [hackingSpeed] • +20 [processingPower]

Colonization Multiplier
This will apply a multiplier to the maximum amount of systems you can have colonized. Leaving this at 1x will have no effect.
You will have 75% lower overcolonization limit.
You will have 50% lower overcolonization limit.
You will have a 25% lower overcolonization limit.
1x
You will have the standard overcolonization limit.
You will have a 50% larger overcolonization limit.
2x
You will have a 100% larger overcolonization limit.
You will have a 150% larger overcolonization limit.
3x
You will have a 200% larger overcolonization limit.
You will have a 250% larger overcolonization limit.
4x
You will have a 300% larger overcolonization limit.
You will have a 350% larger overcolonization limit.
5x
You will have a 400% larger overcolonization limit.

This determines the number of stars in the galaxy (this is further affected by System Density). This also determines the amount of curiosities and anomalies in the galaxy, they will roughly follow the following percentages: • ~50% of all Curios will be Anomalies, ~33% of all Curios will be Loot • ~3.5% of all Curios will be for T2 Strategics • ~2.5% of all Curios will be for Common Luxuries, T1 Strategics, T3 Strategics, and Pre-Revealed Strategic Deposits (each) • ~2% of all Curios will be Uncommon Luxuries, and 1% will be Rare Luxuries
Exceptional galaxy size is recommended for 14 players. The Galaxy will spawn with: • 140 Nodes • 28 Isolated Nodes • ~600 Total Curiosities • 10 Minor Factions in the Galactic Core
Colossal galaxy size is recommended for 12 players. The Galaxy will spawn with: • 120 Nodes • 24 Isolated Nodes • ~500 Total Curiosities • 8 Minor Factions in the Galactic Core
Huge galaxy size is recommended for 10 players. The Galaxy will spawn with: • 100 Nodes • 20 Isolated Nodes • ~400 Total Curiosities • 5 Minor Factions in the Galactic Core
Large galaxy size is recommended for 8 players. The Galaxy will spawn with: • 80 Nodes • 16 Isolated Nodes • ~350 Total Curiosities • 4 Minor Factions in the Galactic Core
Normal galaxy size is recommended for 6 players. The Galaxy will spawn with: • 60 Nodes • 12 Isolated Nodes • ~250 Total Curiosities • 3 Minor Factions in the Galactic Core
Small galaxy size is recommended for 4 players. The Galaxy will spawn with: • 40 Nodes • 8 Isolated Nodes • ~200 Total Curiosities • 2 Minor Factions in the Galactic Core
Tiny galaxy size is recommended for 2 players. The Galaxy will spawn with: • 20 Nodes • 4 Isolated Nodes • ~100 Total Curiosities • 1 Minor Factions in the Galactic Core
The size of the galaxy will be chosen randomly.
Node Connectivity
The maximum number of connections that each node (generally a System) has
There will be up to 4 connections per node on average
There will be up to 2 connections per node on average
There will only be 1 connection per node on average
Additional Curiosities

Determines the quantity of loot curiosities spawned in addition to the curiosities spawned by galaxy generation. The exact number of loot curiosities will be determined by the amount of loot curiosities spawned in your chosen galaxy size multiplied by the multiplier you choose.
None
No additional loot curiosities will spawn.
50% additional loot curiosities will spawn.
2x
100% additional loot curiosities will spawn.
150% additional loot curiosities will spawn.
3x
200% additional loot curiosities will spawn.
Additional Anomalies

Determines the quantity of loot curiosities spawned in addition to the curiosities spawned by galaxy generation. The exact number of anomalies will be determined by the amount of anomalies spawned in your chosen galaxy size multiplied by the multiplier you choose. These anomalies may ignore normal galaxy generation rules.
None
No additional anomalies will spawn.
50% additional anomalies will spawn.
2x
100% additional anomalies will spawn.
150% additional anomalies will spawn.
3x
200% additional anomalies will spawn.
30% of all nodes will be special nodes.
20% of all nodes will be special nodes.
10% of all nodes will be special nodes.
0% of all nodes will be special nodes.
Resources will be common, so many resources may be subject to monopolies. 50% more deposits will spawn, and they are more likely to be rich deposits.
Most Systems will have Resources, so there will be a better chance to acquire monopolies. The standard amount of anomalies will spawn, and they are more likely to be average deposits.
Resources will be rare, so conquest and diplomacy will be needed to acquire monopolies. 50% less deposits will spawn, and they are more likely to be poor deposits.
Anomalies will be rare, having only one anomaly per system will be common 50% less anomalies will spawn.
Anomalies will be somewhat common, most planets should have its own anomaly. The standard amount of anomalies will spawn.
Anomalies will be common, every planet should have its own anomaly. 50% more anomalies will spawn.
Generous
Anomalies will be generously spread throughout the galaxy, every planet should have at least one anomaly. 100% more anomalies will spawn.
Plentiful
Anomalies plentifully spread throughout the galaxy, every planet should have multiple anomalies. 200% more anomalies will spawn.
Curiosities will be scarce, some systems may only have a single curiosity. 50% less curiosities will spawn.
Curiosities will be uncommon, most planets will have curiosities. The standard amount of curiosities will spawn.
Curiosities will be common, it'd be uncommon for a planet to not have a curiosity on it. 50% more curiosities will spawn.
Generous
Curiosities will be generously spread throughout the galaxy, with many planets having multiple curiosities. 100% more curiosities will spawn.
Plentiful
Curiosities will be plentifully spread throughout the galaxy, every planet will have many curiosities. 200% more curiosities will spawn.
Enable Battle Rewatch
Players will not be able to rewatch fights.
Players will be able to rewatch fights.
Easy difficulty for Minor Civilizations, they will produce fleets that serve as nothing more than an annoyance.
Normal difficulty for Minor Civilizations, they will produce fleets that will reasonably hinder your conquest of them.
Hard difficulty for Minor Civilizations, they will produce fleets that will be somewhat challenge to conquer.
#FF0000#Endless#REVERT#
Endless difficulty for Minor Civilizations, A horrible cocktail of things Arphar has designed specifically to kill you. Minor factions will generate large murderous fleets designed to ruin your day.
Pirate Lairs will not spawn, but pirates can still be created via rebellion.
Easy
Pirates will create small-sized fleets that will annoy you from time to time, and pirate lairs will grow slowly.
Normal
Pirates will create medium-sized fleets that should pose no serious threat if taken care of quickly, and pirate lairs will grow at an average speed.
Hard
Pirates will create large-sized fleets that serve to hinder the expansion of an ill-prepared empire, and pirate lairs will grow quickly
#FF0000#Endless#REVERT#
Pirates will create massive fleets with ships designed by Arphar (who does not like you), and pirate lairs will be near impregnable fortresses.
Academy Difficulty
Level of difficulty of the Academy Faction. (How much of a gameplay challenge they present to the player)
The Academy will create a few patrols and war ships, but nothing formidable.
The Academy will create a powerful military force that could pose a challenge to an unprepared player.
The Academy will create multiple powerful forces that could cripple an unprepared player.
#FF0000#Endless#REVERT#
Arphar has been giving some tips to Isyander about how to ruin your day, and Isyander has taken this to heart and will exclusively pump out ships that give you nightmares.
